I was only 12 when Nixon was re-elected and then was brought down by Watergate.

And what's so remarkable is that as he was winning his 49-state re-election in 1972, Watergate was already - it was also - still in the news.

And Harry Truman, too, in 1952.

Truman decided not to run for again in '52.
And, of course, George Washington could have run for a third term but elected not to.
